intro: Ebenus horrida, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is known for its hairy, rough-textured leaves and bright yellow ray flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Ebenus horrida is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates.
